page.title: 10The Connswater River cont'd
page.content: of kingfishers flitting up and down the stream. Up to the present time the river has been smelly and dirty because things were getting dumped into it.People got so fed up with the dirt and smell that they decided to set up an action committee, the Connswater River Conservation Committee C.R.C.C. for short. They asked people to volunteer their help to clean the river as well as asking the government for help. So far this year 12 cars, 24 shopping trolleys and two lorryloads full of dirt and rubbish have been removed. Young people have been helped by the Dept of Agriculture to dredge away the smelly mud and clean the overgrown banks on either side. The committee hopes to transform the Connswater from a smelly eyesore into an amenity for the people of East Belfast.
